# The `FunctionPass` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/functionpass">FunctionPass</a> class - This class is used to implement most global optimizations. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Declaration

<CodeBlock>class llvm::FunctionPass</CodeBlock>

## Description {#details}

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/functionpass">FunctionPass</a> class - This class is used to implement most global optimizations.

Optimizations should subclass this class if they meet the following constraints:


<ul>
<li>Optimizations are organized globally, i.e., a function at a time</li>
<li>Optimizing a function does not cause the addition or removal of any functions in the module</li>
</ul>

Definition at line 310 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/pass-h">Pass.h</a>.

## Protected Member Functions

### skipFunction() {#af9f5f511d75e16f09a5520cb9444cfa8}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool FunctionPass::skipFunction (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function">Function</a> &amp; F) const</>}
  labels = {["protected"]}>
Optional passes call this function to check whether the pass should be skipped.

This is the case when Attribute::OptimizeNone is set or when optimization bisect is over the limit.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/pass-h/#l00331">331</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/pass-h">Pass.h</a>, definition at line 178 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/sandboxir/pass-cpp">Pass.cpp</a>.
